sen.j: 呑竜（どんりゅう、弘治 (日本)2年4月23日 (旧暦)（1556年6月2日） - 元和 (日本)9年8月9日 (旧暦)（1623年9月3日））は、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代前期にかけての浄土宗の僧。
sen.e: Ryu DON June 2, 1556 - Sep 3, 1623) was a monk of the Jodo (Pure Land) sect of Buddhism during the Warring States period through to the early Edo period.
Donryu (June 2, 1556 - September 3, 1623) was a monk of the Jodo (Pure Land) sect of Buddhism during the Warring States period through to the early Edo period.
Donryu (June 2, 1556 - September 3, 1623) was a monk of the Jodo (Pure Land) sect of Buddhism during the Warring States period through to the early Edo period.

sen.j: 字は故信、法号は源蓮社然誉。
sen.e: He went by the pen names: 故信 and 源蓮社然誉
His azana (Chinese courtesy name of adult male) was Koshin and his posthumous Buddhist title is Gen renja nenyo.
sen.cmt: 原文に「法号は」を補足のうえ再訳出しました。なお、法号は「源蓮社然誉大阿」で完全のようです。参考：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%91%91%E7%AB%9C
sen.e: His azana (Chinese courtesy name of adult male) was Koshin and his posthumous Buddhist title is Gen renja nenyo.

sen.j: 武蔵国埼玉郡の生まれ。
sen.e: Born in Saitama County in Musashi Province.
He was born in Sakitama no kori (or Saitama-gun) County in Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: 主語・用語を修正しました
sen.e: He was born in Sakitama no kori (or Saitama-gun) County in Musashi Province.

sen.j: 幼くして故郷の林西寺の岌弁（きゅうべん）に師事して出家し、その後江戸芝増上寺で修学した。
sen.e: As a young child in his home town he was a pupil of Kyuben of Rinsai-ji temple and, subsequently studied at Zojo-ji temple in Shiba, Edo.
As a young child in his home town he was a pupil of Kyuben of Rinsai-ji (or possibly Rinsei-ji) Temple and entered the Buddhist priesthood, and subsequently studied at Zojo-ji temple in Shiba, Edo.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ箇所を加筆しました
sen.e: As a young child in his home town he was a pupil of Kyuben of Rinsai-ji (or possibly Rinsei-ji) Temple and entered the Buddhist priesthood, and subsequently studied at Zojo-ji temple in Shiba, Edo.

sen.j: やがて、武蔵国八王子にある大善寺 (八王子市)（浄土宗関東十八檀林の1つ）の3世となりました。
sen.e: Over time he became the 3rd generation head monk of Daizen-ji temple (1 of 18 key Jodo Sect temples in the Kanto region) in Hachioji, Musashi Province (present day Hachioji City).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Over time he became the 3rd generation head monk of Daizen-ji temple (one of 18 danrin [key Jodo Sect temples where monks are trained] in the Kanto region) in Hachioji, Musashi Province (present-day Hachioji City).
sen.cmt: 表現・用語を補足修正しました
sen.e: Over time he became the 3rd generation head monk of Daizen-ji temple (one of 18 danrin [key Jodo Sect temples where monks are trained] in the Kanto region) in Hachioji, Musashi Province (present-day Hachioji City).

sen.j: 浄土宗檀林（浄土宗僧侶の養成所）の基礎固めを行った。
sen.e: This venue became established amongst the key Jodo Sect temples as a seminary for Jodo sect trainee priests.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Donryu solidified the foundation of this venue which became established among the danrin temples as a seminary for Jodo sect trainee priests.
Donryu solidified the foundation of this venue which became established among the danrin temples as a seminary for Jodo sect trainee priests.

sen.j: 1613年（慶長18年）徳川家康の命により上野国太田に大光院が建立され、呑竜はその開山となった。
sen.e: In 1613 at the order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Daiko-in Temple was constructed in Ota, Kozuke Province with Ryu DON presiding over its consecration.
In 1613, at the order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Daiko-in Temple was constructed in Ota, Kozuke Province with Donryu presiding over its consecration as the kaizan (founder).
In 1613, at the order of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Daiko-in Temple was constructed in Ota, Kozuke Province with Donryu presiding over its consecration as the kaizan (founder).

sen.j: 1616年（元和2年）、孝心のため国禁を犯した子をかくまい幕府から譴責されたが、5年後の1621年（元和7年）に赦免された。
sen.e: In 1616 although prohibited, he gave shelter to his child out of filial devotion and incurred a rebuke from the shogunate however, 5 years later (1621) he was pardoned.
In 1616, he gave shelter to a child who had violated a shogunal taboo out of filial devotion and therefore incurred a rebuke from the shogunate, but 5 years later, in 1621, he was pardoned.
sen.cmt: 誤解釈箇所を加筆修正しました
sen.e: In 1616, he gave shelter to a child who had violated a shogunal taboo out of filial devotion and therefore incurred a rebuke from the shogunate, but 5 years later, in 1621, he was pardoned.

sen.j: このことから、子育て呑竜の異名で呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: For that reason, he became known by the nickname `Child-carer Don RYU`.
For that reason, he became known by the nickname: Kosodate Donryu (Donryu the Child-carer).
sen.cmt: 表現・形式を修正しました。なお、「子育て呑竜」の名の由来は、「堕胎の風習を憂い、貧民の子どもたちを引き取って寺で養育したから」というのが通説のようです。参考：[1] http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?p=%E5%91%91%E7%AB%9C&dtype=0&dname=0ss [2] http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%91%91%E7%AB%9C
sen.e: For that reason, he became known by the nickname: Kosodate Donryu (Donryu the Child-carer).
